findings.risk: You own the output therefore any infringement it causes is your fault
It can generate information that could potentially be used in fraud
It can imitate people’s linkness
Deleted information is retained even if you try to remove it (just gets de-identified and dissociated from your account
Opting out of your data being used for training might limit you
Any content uploaded could be used and modified by DALLE legally
Defaults you as an “opt in” participant to using your content to train models, and you must opt out of this feature, also ambiguity about what data they still use
Any generated content can be used worldwide by openAI
Collection of many details including personal information, log data, prompts and uploaded content including images
Any personal information given to the service may be lost, altered, misused and accessed without authorisation
Risk that (possibly sensitive) content is used in training models
Will transfer your personal data with counterparties and other companies involved in their “strategic transactions or organisations”
Will provide personal data to affiliates (which could be any shareholders/investors in a company)
It will store your prompts & other data and pass it on to third parties
Violates intellectual property frequently enough to warrant a form
If a user publishes a video to the explore page they lose control of their IP
Users can input content of any people or place or thing, and manipulate it with no proof of consent
Risk of intellectual property rights being infringed
Super realistic output which could be used for misinformation
Risk of users representing that output was human-generated
Output may be inaccurate, incomplete or offensive
Risk of hallucination in high-risk areas such as health information
The model is not suitable for interpreting specialized medical images like CT scans and shouldn't be used for medical advice
The model may generate incorrect descriptions or captions in certain scenarios
Risk that service can violate peoples rights
If you connect contacts it will share all of them and store it
You share the names and phone numbers of anyone in your address book who never agreed to OpenAI’s terms
Will use any public data on the internet, this could lead to a model training itself on harmful or abusive content
Openly states that it can produce harmful content that goes against company values
No active detection for content that violates ToS all “proactive”
Doesn’t verify age of users, claims that only 13+ but no policies enforce this
The API doesn’t have to necessarily respect your privacy rights, so a wrapper might not need to follow the rules
